properties.areaDesc: Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 1 at 4:16AM MST until January 2 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Great Falls MT
properties.description:
* WHAT...Mixed precipitation occurring above 5000 feet. Additional
snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches at pass level, 7 to 13
inches above pass level, and 4 inches or less at lower
elevations. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph.

* WHERE...Northern Rocky Mountain Front and Southern Rocky
Mountain Front above 5000 feet.

* WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Areas of blowing snow
could significantly reduce visibility.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY ABOVE 5000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED
